summary: This function compares two values and then returns the result.
returns: The result is negative when (left < right), zero when (left == right), and positive when (left > right).
details: A null value is considered to be less-than a non-null value.
example-1: module Main in execution;%0A%0A@Start%0Adefun main (args : String[]) : void%0A{%0A    F::println( F::compare(2, 3) );%0A    F::println( F::compare(3, 3) );%0A    F::println( F::compare(3, 2) );%0A    F::println();%0A%0A    F::println( F::compare(null,    0) );%0A    F::println( F::compare(null, null) );%0A    F::println( F::compare(   0, null) );%0A    F::println();%0A}
